caption.p: The spatial variation of mean JJAS (Juneâ€“September) convective precipitation over the south Asian region from observation ( a), GC1 ( b), GC2 ( c), GC3 ( d), and GC4 ( e). The biases in mean JJAS convective precipitation for different groups with respect to observation are shown in ( f) for GC1, ( g) for GC2, ( h) for GC3, and ( i) for GC4. Hatching show bias to be coming from atmospheric component and stippling show bias to be coming from oceanic components (i.e. biases in SSTs and atmosphere-ocean feedbacks) and the biases are significant the level of 99%.
